conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring all health data streams including without patient consent, while User Story B requires manual control to respect client privacy preferences, effectively forbidding automatic or unauthorized data recording and sharing. These impose contradictory requirements on data access and sharing under the same conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to monitor all available health data streams quickly, prioritizing clinical information even if patient consent is not granted, to support efficient care during shifts.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to manually choose which cognitive game sessions to record and share to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while supporting their engagement.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Balance clinical monitoring needs and privacy by limiting automatic data access to urgent cases with patient consent, while caregivers manage session recordings respecting preferences.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor critical health data streams promptly with patient consent to support efficient care during shifts.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually select which cognitive game sessions to record and share to respect client privacy preferences.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring health data even without patient consent, while User Story B forbids accessing detailed vitals without explicit client consent. These impose incompatible constraints on data access under the same conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to monitor all available health data streams quickly, prioritizing clinical information even if patient consent is not granted, to support efficient care during shifts.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple elderly clients, I want to access detailed vitals and activity reports only when I manually choose to record and clients consent, ensuring privacy is respected while providing personalized care.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Balance clinical urgency with privacy by allowing medical staff to monitor critical health data during emergencies without consent, while informal caregivers access detailed vitals only with explicit consent.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor critical health data promptly during emergencies, even without patient consent, to ensure timely care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to access detailed vitals only with explicit client consent to respect privacy while providing personalized care.

conflictDescription: User Story A mandates monitoring all available health data streams even without patient consent, while User Story B strictly forbids automatic data logging and requires manual control to respect privacy, creating an incompatible requirement regarding data collection and sharing.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to monitor all available health data streams quickly, prioritizing clinical information even if patient consent is not granted, to support efficient care during shifts.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic health data logging and manually select what is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to respect privacy by monitoring only health data streams with patient consent, while User Story B remains focused on manual control to ensure privacy, resolving the conflict by aligning data collection with consent.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor all available health data streams with patient consent to support efficient care during shifts.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic health data logging and manually select what is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires monitoring all available health data streams even without patient consent, while User Story B forbids automatic logging and requires manual selection to fully respect privacy preferences, creating a strict opposition on performing data logging.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to monitor all available health data streams quickly, prioritizing clinical information even if patient consent is not granted, to support efficient care during shifts.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic logging and manually choose what health data is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while providing attentive care.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance efficient health monitoring with respect for privacy by allowing automatic monitoring with patient consent and manual selection otherwise.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to monitor all available health data streams with patient consent to support efficient care during shifts.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to disable automatic logging and manually select health data to respect each client's privacy preferences.

conflictDescription: User Story A mandates scheduling video check-ins without patient consent (start operation without consent), while User Story B requires manual choice to record and share sessions respecting privacy preferences (forbid automatic sharing), creating opposite expectations on consent and sharing of video-related operations.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to schedule video check-ins without requiring patient consent to prioritize health monitoring and maintain professional boundaries.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to manually choose which cognitive game sessions to record and share to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while supporting their engagement.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Introduce a context-aware policy that requires patient consent for video check-ins except in emergency health monitoring situations, balancing privacy and professional needs.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to schedule video check-ins with patient consent except in emergencies to prioritize health monitoring while respecting privacy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose which cognitive game sessions to record and share to fully respect clients' privacy preferences.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires scheduling video check-ins without patient consent, while User Story B forbids initiating video calls unless clients explicitly allow, imposing opposite expectations on video call initiation.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to schedule video check-ins without requiring patient consent to prioritize health monitoring and maintain professional boundaries.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to initiate video calls only when absolutely necessary and always honor clientsâ€™ wishes to decline to protect their privacy.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to incorporate a context-aware policy that respects patient consent while allowing video check-ins in emergency or critical health monitoring scenarios.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want to schedule video check-ins respecting patient consent except in critical health situations to ensure timely monitoring.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to initiate video calls only with client consent to protect their privacy and dignity.

userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic health data logging and manually select what is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Modify User Story A to require patient consent for video check-ins except in emergencies, and update User Story B to allow configurable automatic logging respecting privacy preferences, enabling a context-aware balance.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires scheduling video check-ins without patient consent (mandating operation), while User Story B requires manual control to disable automatic logging and sharing of health data to fully respect privacy, effectively forbidding automatic data collection and sharing. These impose opposite constraints on health data access and sharing.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff, I want to schedule video check-ins without requiring patient consent to prioritize health monitoring and maintain professional boundaries.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic logging and manually choose what health data is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while providing attentive care.

newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic logging and manually choose what health data is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while providing attentive care.

conflictDescription: User Story A mandates accessing patient health data without consent in emergencies, while User Story B strictly requires accessing detailed vitals only with client consent, thus forbidding access without consent under any circumstance.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want to access my patient's validated health data quickly without needing their consent to ensure timely and effective care during emergencies.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple elderly clients, I want to access detailed vitals and activity reports only when I manually choose to record and clients consent, ensuring privacy is respected while providing personalized care.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Clarified emergency access to health data without consent is allowed only for validated medical staff in emergencies, while informal caregivers require explicit client consent for accessing detailed vitals under normal conditions.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want to access my patient's validated health data without needing their consent during emergencies to ensure timely and effective care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to access detailed vitals and activity reports only when clients have given consent to ensure privacy while providing personalized care.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires accessing patient health data without consent in emergencies, while User Story B forbids automatic health data logging and mandates manual control to respect privacy, creating a conflict between mandatory access and strict forbidding of data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want to access my patient's validated health data quickly without needing their consent to ensure timely and effective care during emergencies.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic health data logging and manually select what is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to clarify conditions under which data access or logging occurs, balancing emergency access and privacy control via explicit consent and override policies.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want to access validated patient health data quickly during emergencies with appropriate override permissions to ensure timely care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to disable automatic health data logging and manually control data sharing to respect client privacy preferences under normal conditions.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires accessing patient health data without consent in emergencies, while User Story B forbids automatic data logging and sharing to respect privacy, creating a direct conflict on whether data access/sharing is allowed under certain conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member, I want to access my patient's validated health data quickly without needing their consent to ensure timely and effective care during emergencies.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to disable automatic logging and manually choose what health data is recorded and shared to fully respect each client's privacy preferences while providing attentive care.
cluster: Balance patient autonomy with clinical access
resolutionDescription: Refined both user stories to clarify that emergency data access without consent is allowed only under strict conditions, while caregivers control data logging respecting privacy outside emergencies.
newUserStoryASummary: As medical staff, I want emergency access to validated patient data without consent to ensure timely care in critical situations.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control automatic health data logging and sharing to respect privacy while supporting ongoing care.
